intro: Quercus slavonica, commonly known as the Slavonian oak, is a deciduous tree native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its deeply lobed leaves and acorn-producing capsules. The tree typically grows to a height of 15–25 meters, with a broad, rounded crown. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing a rugged appearance. The Slavonian oak is adapted to temperate climates and plays an important role in local ecosystems.
